trans-unit.source: Restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore deleted database, recover deleted database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore deleted database, recover deleted database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to restore a deleted Azure SQL database in the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can restore a database that was deleted during its retention period to the point it was deleted.
trans-unit.target: You can restore a database that was deleted during its retention period to the point it was deleted.

trans-unit.source: The retention period is determined by the service tier of the database.
trans-unit.target: The retention period is determined by the service tier of the database.

trans-unit.source: Restoring a deleted Azure SQL database creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: Restoring a deleted Azure SQL database creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.
trans-unit.target: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact <linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact <linkText>Azure Support</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Restoring a deleted Azure SQL database is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Restoring a deleted Azure SQL database is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.
trans-unit.target: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.

trans-unit.source: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.
trans-unit.target: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.

trans-unit.source: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.
trans-unit.target: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support restoring a deleted SQL database.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support restoring a deleted SQL database.

trans-unit.source: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> using your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the <linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title> using your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation, click SQL DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation, click SQL DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the page, click DELETED DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the page, click DELETED DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: A list of RESTORABLE DELETED DATABASES is shown.
trans-unit.target: A list of RESTORABLE DELETED DATABASES is shown.

trans-unit.source: Click the database you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: Click the database you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click Restore.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click Restore.

trans-unit.source: This launches the Specify restore settings dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This launches the Specify restore settings dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Choose a DATABASE NAME.
trans-unit.target: Choose a DATABASE NAME.

trans-unit.source: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.
trans-unit.target: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.

trans-unit.source: Note that a deleted database can only be restored to the server from which it was deleted, and to the point in time at which it was deleted.
trans-unit.target: Note that a deleted database can only be restored to the server from which it was deleted, and to the point in time at which it was deleted.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.

trans-unit.source: A restore may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A restore may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click DETAILS.
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click DETAILS.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Business Continuity</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Business Continuity</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Backup and Restore</linkText><title></title>
